Just out of curiosity, what is your favorite beer? 
 
 Mine: Yuengling Premium. Perhaps someone might give me an idea of something new to try.

Just out of curiosity, what is your favorite beer? 
 
 Mine: Yuengling Premium. Perhaps someone might give me an idea of something new to try.

 The next one...as long as it's cold! emoticon_xclown 
 
 Actually I like Miller High Life, Heinekin, Red Stripe, XX, and some others. Miller High Life (the champagne of bottled beer) wins more blind taste tests than any other brand.
 
 The best beer I EVER had was in Germany at a construction site. At the end of the work day, our hosts pulled out a black garbage bag loaded with marianated pork steaks and a couple of cases of beer that had been sitting unrefrigerated on the back of the truck all day. They cooked the pork over a charcoal fire, toasted some bread and we had one of the best meals I've had in my life. The beer was almost warm, but that seemed to make the whole meal better.

 Hot dammit....I knew there was a reason I liked you. emoticon_xagree

I think that is only a Pa, south jersey thing. I am orginally from South jersey right out side Philly. 
 
 Corona is my choice for beer, but I am more of a wine drinker.

 Actually, Yuengling has become an east coast thing. I could buy it in Ft. Lauderdale before I moved back to Philly. They opened a second brewery in Florida due to increasing demands. I think they sell in about 10-15 east coast states now.
Guiness, anyone? It's a pint AND a meal in one!

Right now I'd have to say Killian's Irish Red. I also like Newcastle a lot. 
 
 I was in Germany too a little over a year ago with a friend who goes there often. We were in Cologne, and tried a beer called Kölsch. It was fantastic and might be the best I've ever had.

Root
 That's my favorite kind of beer.
 
 Now if I make anyone mad at this, I apologize. But due to my inability to drink any kind of alcohol for personal health reasons, I say my favorite kind of beer is root beer. Actually, that's what I did when I turned 21. I went and got a 6-pack of bottled root beer. A&W. But I have health problems that make me unable to drink anything with alcohol and I like to drive (or rather need to a lot of times) too much to drink alcohol.

Just out of curiosity, what is your favorite beer?

 Here's to a long life and a merry one.

 A cold pint-- and another one!

Yep we keep a small refrig just for beer and wine. Does anyone else like their whiskey cold for sippin' ?
I love whiskey but promised the little lady <yeah, rightemoticon_rolleyes < I'd let it go. That's one promise I have been able to keep thanks to good, cold, frosty beer.emoticon_xhoho
oh man, I do love a good shot of whiskey on occassion. Knob Creek. Enough said.

Yep we keep a small refrig just for beer and wine. Does anyone else like their whiskey cold for sippin' ?

 Cold? Never. With a little room temperature spring water...perhaps. I find that chilling it, and yes I have tried, tends to hide the true character of the whiskey, especially irish whiskey and scotch. I find that I get more expression of the flavors and a more lingering aftertaste in the palate when it is room temperature. 
 
 I like irish whiskey the best. Actually, had a glass last night. 12 year old Tullamore Dew. Mmmmmmm. Can't beat it.
Chimay and Singha, but I drink heineken most often.
